title: Provides for the revocation of insurers license and prohibit sale of new policies where insurer cancels or fails to renew two percent or more of home owner policies
summary: Provides for the revocation of insurers license, and prohibits the sale of new policies where insurer cancels or fails to renew two percent or more of home owner policies in high risk areas, including coastal areas; provides such insurer may reapply in one year.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1118

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  PARKER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Insurance

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to  revoking  an  insurer
         license for canceling two percent or more of its homeowner policies in
         the state

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 1104 of the insurance law is amended  by  adding  a
    2  new subsection (e) to read as follows:
    3    (E)  NOTWITHSTANDING  ANY LAW, RULE OR REGULATION TO THE CONTRARY, THE
    4  SUPERINTENDENT SHALL REVOKE ANY LICENSE ISSUED AND PROHIBIT SUCH INSURER
    5  FROM ACCEPTING ANY NEW POLICIES IF, AFTER NOTICE AND HEARING, THE SUPER-
    6  INTENDENT FINDS THAT SUCH INSURER HAS CANCELLED OR FAILED TO  RENEW  TWO
    7  PERCENT  OR  MORE  OF  HOMEOWNER PROPERTY/CASUALTY POLICIES IN HIGH RISK
    8  AREAS, INCLUDING COASTAL AREAS.  THE INSURED MAY APPLY FOR REINSTATEMENT
    9  ONE YEAR FROM THE DATE OF REVOCATION.
   10    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02136-01-1
